Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I need...
Reviews.Author: Peter G.
Reviews.Content: I needed a phone while traveling overseas. This thing is absolutely perfect. $29 shipped, are you kidding?Takes pictures, has a rather good FM radio, holds the charge fantastic, and most importantly it's a telephone. Takes two sims and a memory card. Yes, it isn't a $800 smart phone, but I wouldn't cry for it if I lost it or got pickpocketed. BLU nailed this one. For $29 it's an easy 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Cute and Functional
Reviews.Author: Mohammed R.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mother who will be traveling out of the country and isnt very good with phones. I got her this thinking that it was a cheap and was already unlocked. It came in and I was very pleased. It was plastic but good build quality, big screen and button, and has the option of 2 sim cards! I tried it with my Tmobile sim and it worked perfectly. This phone is great for anyone that is traveling out of the country!

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone
Reviews.Author: Alvlack
Reviews.Content: Perfect phone for persons who doesn't like high tech and travelers who use 2 different cell companies one local and one for a different country also it is a high quality phone for a low price.

Reviews.Title: BLU Jenny TV 2.8 T176T
Reviews.Author: CRN9
Reviews.Content: Got what I expected, an inexpensive phone with basic functionality. The TV actually worked, I was able to get some kinda channel in Spanish. No complaints so far.

Reviews.Title: Returned/open boxed item
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a simple phone for my young cousins abroad and I thought this would do the trick. I believe wholeheartedly that BREED sold me a returned item. The back cover of the phone was not properly closed and when I opened the inside box, ALL the components that came with phone are out of their plastic bags and the bags were bunched up and shoved into the comers and under the components. I don't care how cheap the phone is I still paid for a new one. The USB cable doesn't even fit in the port all the way. There were other slight problems with the phone but at this point it doesn't even matter because I'm returning the phone regardless. I'm very weary of BREED as a seller. It's a shame that they seem to be among the very few people who sell BLU phones on Amazon if not I would stay away completely.

Reviews.Title: Can't handle basic cell phone functions
Reviews.Author: shadow460
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone strictly as a backup while I'm between smart phones. It makes and takes calls as you'd expect, but unfortunately, no matter how hard we try, it's impossible to stop the barrage of text and multimedia messages. A simple multi recipient message was all it took to make this phone go completely crazy.The phone does not have facebook and social media functions like the description said. Again, it's just a backup, so that's OK. The TV function doesn't work. Again, just a backup phone, so no loss. It doesn't recognize all my ringtones. Again, it's a backup... you get the idea.Where I drew the line was when a simple message caused it to receive gibberish text messages at a rate of two to three a minute. I could no more put the phone down than it would ring again, and there would be more gibberish coming from the same source. Adding that source to the phone's blacklist did nothing to help--the "messages" came through even FASTER.I plugged my SIM cards into an unlocked Android, set up the APN, and the group message showed right up as it was meant to.IF you can convince your friends to never text you again, maybe this phone would be a good choice if you wash your Android like I did. IF you could disable text messaging on this phone (or through your provider), then maybe this would be a good spare phone.If all you want is a simple, basic, phone that makes and takes calls, then go buy that phone over there instead.

Reviews.Title: Did what I needed
Reviews.Author: Arleen
Reviews.Content: For various family reasons, we needed to be able to make affordable voice calls back to the US while traveling in Costa Rica. This phone fit the bill just fine. Bought a Kolbi SIM card in a small grocery store (just $2), and was assigned a local phone # and PIN. Calling US cost I think 29 cents/min. Reloading more $$ on the card was easy. Texting is old-school due to no QWERTY keyboard, but manageable.

Reviews.Title: Great as a second phone
Reviews.Author: Frederick Meyer
Reviews.Content: 4 stars because is a 30 $ phone, you can never compare it with a smart phone. the Basics functions are ok, calling and receiving phone calls, texting, local analog tv is very good as the fm radio, the other functions are trash. too small memory, complicated menu, good screen. Good as a travel phone, both sims work fine.

Reviews.Title: horrible phone
Reviews.Author: v49753
Reviews.Content: These phones are horrible!!! I bought two from the same place and they are just horrible! Very staticky! And sometimes calls and messages won't go through, horrible just horrible

Reviews.Title: It's Liked!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A.
Reviews.Content: This phone was bought as a gift for someone in the Carribean Islands and there haven't been any complaints about it.

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone
Reviews.Author: G. Bowman
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this little phone! It is a solid basic phone that gets good reception. It can play videos and music from an SD card. It takes reasonable, if low res (1.3mp), pics. Its a comfortable size to hold and use, even for texting with one hand.It does have a few drawbacks which matter less to me because this is a backup and a "Mom can still contact me even though I'm Grounded" phone:1) It does not have T9 predictive texting.2) I cannot seem to set up data for downloading ringtones, wallpaper and arcade games.

Reviews.Title: limited quality product
Reviews.Author: malouche
Reviews.Content: the item arrived on time, however, I am disappointed by the product quality, as the phone looks like a child's toy. Also, it does not have a lock screen option.

Reviews.Title: two sim cell phone
Reviews.Author: Mike D 66
Reviews.Content: At a cost of twenty five dollars with anazon prime, it is easy to use, abd is not overloaded with programs that sonetines cause battery drainage.Plus, the size and thin profile are good, and all letters and numbers are clearly seen.

Reviews.Title: Fellow citizens, Escape and be free!
Reviews.Author: DCDave
Reviews.Content: My "smart" phone was damaged recently so I took it as a sign and an opportunity to free myself from its clutches. I have embraced the freedom of just having a basic phone. I don't need to check the weather every morning--I can look out the window like my ancestors did. I don't need to look at photos that are limited to only 3 inches. I don't need apps that more than waste my time. I don't need a music player which diverts me from engaging in conversations with real people. This phone from Blu--a Florida-based company is very functional. Call quality if fine--great volume, although just slightly muffled. There is jack for head phones, contrary to some reviews. the FM radio has very good reception and is easy to operate if you so inclined. There are many settings for the camera, including white balance! Texting is the old-fashioned way and its works great (texting is something I appreciate). The phone powers up from a shut down in just 8 seconds, and is ready to use. There are three ring tone to choose from and three message alerts as well. The menus are intuitive and a little more complicated than you would expect. The larger screen size is very nice and the graphics are bright, even if not the most crisp like you would see on a smart phone.I ride public transportation to work. Often, every direction I look there is a sea of humanity transfixed, seemingly by their gadgets. Many with earphones on and many playing games. One writer coined the term that we are "amusing ourselves to death." I now think less about checking my emails (can do at home or at work computer) and getting sports scores and more about life and what's happening next to me and what I need to think about in order to grow as a human being. A cell hone is a nice convenience. This phone does the basics very well for such a low cost. And, another benefit, I was able to lower my data plan with AT&T; and saved over 70 dollars a month! Saving money, liberation from time-sucking devise, simplicity and better awareness of surrounding life--free at last!

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Luis Ralph Paul Hennings Noriega
Reviews.Content: It is working very well, it meets our expectations for a basic phone, the extras is like a present, battery lasts a reasonable time. On the other hand, the manual is poorly made, it doesn't came with the memory card so camera or mp3 wont work with out it, and it's only worth buying for the music, the camera is very limited.Very nice look.

Reviews.Title: good all around
Reviews.Author: Anton Nichta "ton"
Reviews.Content: Received phone. Menu was in Spanish. Had a bit of trouble navigating the setup to change to English.Changed photo resolution to a large size (default was a postage size pic). The TV is pretty much useless in the USA. No analog channels. The FM is ok. The Micro card was difficult to install. Had to pry up the metal bracket  to insert the card.Would like to lock/unlock the keypad. No instructions on how to do that. Would like to change the voice volume. No instructions on how to do that either. In fact the micro manual that came with the phone, is pretty much useless. Other than that. Good price. Large bright screen.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the purpose
Reviews.Author: william Osae
Reviews.Content: Perfect and does the job as described. Dual sim cards work perfectly, phone clear and easy to use, fits pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap basic phone...and alarm clock!...and flashlight!...but now outdated
Reviews.Author: harlingford
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these in May 2013 to use during an family trip to Europe. They have worked great as basic phones with SIM cards in both Europe and the US. Lycamobile offers unbelievably cheap never-expire pay-as-you-go deals in both Europe and the US (using T-mobile network in US). Fantastic battery life. Not great for texting since it is an old-school telephone keyboard with no predictive feature. They are really excellent alarm clocks..alarm still works when phone is completely turned off, so batteries last for weeks. Nice snooze function.They also have a nice LED flashlight that has come in handy many times. Strangely, what they don't have is a phone jack, even though they have an FM radio and mp3 player. Until recently I would have said that this phone with a Lycambile SIM and pay-as-you go is the very cheapest combo for simple low-use talk function out there. But now it looks like the BLU Aria (about ~$20) and BLU Zoey (about $18) are even cheaper AND have a headphone jack. So I would probably go with the Zoey instead. If you try Lycamobile, you can get free SIMs with free shipping from Amazon, while ordering from Lycamobile has a $7 shipping charge.

Reviews.Title: Whadda ya want for a phone less than $30?
Reviews.Author: James B Yancey
Reviews.Content: I need a phone to just be a phone.  It rings when it is called, I can hear the person at the other end, they can hear me, I can call other people.  It has a phone list.  I created my own ring tone. 1. Use the recorder function to record the sounds that you want.  2.  Make sure that the source is loud or you place the phone next to the source you are recording.  3.  You do this because there is no volume control.  4.  Save it and make it your ring tone.If you are looking for a smart phone, you need to spend a little bit more money.  For the price of less than $30, you get a camera, radio, a TV, a phone with wi-fi capabilities, video camera, video player, audio recorder and player.  It won't scrub floors

Reviews.Title: not worth it at all
Reviews.Author: Sharon John
Reviews.Content: I choose this phone because of its price and the features that was shown but the phone does not have any instruction how the phone operates,  someone has to call you to change the volume, the camera takes these miniature pictures you cannot even see, I am so disappointed in this buy and I bought 3 of these phones. the only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the screen is so bright and it has the keyboard. The texting box can only hold 40 messages, you can only put in one number at a time for a person even if they might have more than one I can go on and on but I will say not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Pathetic product
Reviews.Author: Kishore Siddegowda
Reviews.Content: This stopped working 2 days after I received it. The incoming audio simply completely stopped working. When I tried to contact the customer support, all I got to hear was an irritating song on IVR for 30 minutes. No human bothered to answer my call for 30 minutes. Frustrated I have thrown this device to the dust bin. I thought it would be a good buy for just $30 but realized that you get junk if you pay junk.

Reviews.Title: As described
Reviews.Author: esskayess
Reviews.Content: Real good. Works internationally. The phone works in the US / UK / France / Hong Kong & India.Well done

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this phone
Reviews.Author: Parker "scootin' kitty"
Reviews.Content: I really want to love this phone.  It's cheap, it comes in a couple color choices, and other folks seem to like theirs.  Sadly, I only find it acceptable.  The television feature doesn't work, the manual is a joke, and worst of all, the speaker-phone function is unusable, as nobody can hear me when I try to use it.  I've tried it out on different people, in places with different sound levels, and it's 100 percent a fail.  The person I'm talking to can tell I'm speaking, but it's too blurry and faint to understand what I'm saying.  I use (or used to use) the speakerphone a lot, so this really bothers me.All that being said, it has large buttons, so would be good for an older person who is savvy enough to figure out how to use it (given the poor manual).

Reviews.Title: WORKS FINE
Reviews.Author: javito27
Reviews.Content: Buy this phone for double chip and basically tv signal, and truth works perfectly, the cost is the best purchase I have made. Have access to social networking but is a little complex.

Reviews.Title: BLU T176T Jenny TV 2.8
Reviews.Author: Michael Korchonnoff
Reviews.Content: Nice phone, pretty versatile with all the features - I especially like the large display, alarm, radio, black list and bright LED flashlight. I haven't found a way to adjust the volume and the sound is not the greatest but you can plug in earphones and the radio sounds great. It's fairly large (5"x 21/4") and unless you lock it, the buttons will be very easily pressed in your pocket. I couldn't tell if the battery indicator was working at first, you have to look at it at the right angle (from above) to see the difference in colors, but it works. Overall a great phone for the price if you need to travel outside the US, because of the Quad-band capability (you will still need to get a SIM card in the country you are travelling to).

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: annie cruz
Reviews.Content: I needed a phone while traveling overseas. This thing is absolutely perfect. $29 shipped, are you kidding?Takes pictures, has a rather good FM radio, holds the charge fantastic, and most importantly it's a telephone. Takes two sims and a memory card. Yes, it isn't a $800 smart phone, but I wouldn't cry for it if I lost it or got pickpocketed. BLU nailed this one. For $29 it's an easy 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: A weird disappointment
Reviews.Author: Noname Smith
Reviews.Content: Good points 1) Dual SIM card, 2) Quad band, 3) Push button rather than touch screen so no daily recharging.Bad points 1) No volume adjustment, 2) No key lock out, 3) No permanent SIM card selection.  Must select theSIM card for each call and phone book entry.  4) Every call requires extra button pushes because of primitiveOperating System, 5) The manual is printed very poorly and impossible to read without a microscope.  The phonedefault language is Spanish (sorry to be a chauvinist).To me, a confirmed Luddite, the disadvantages out way the advantages.

Reviews.Title: No-frills phone that works marvelously
Reviews.Author: Nick "whereishawkins"
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively, and am used to swapping out SIM cards. I needed a "local phone" and spent time on Amazon looking for inexpensive phones that "just worked" and always saw BLU popping up in search results. I looked at the price and took a pass, figuring that they're not worth it at that price and looked at things that were 3x the cost.  But I took a chance and bought the Jenny TV 2.8 and figured, why not?I was pleasantly surprised.It's a quad-band GSM phone, so it'll work all over. The phone feels light and is very plastic-y, yet solid and took a few accidental drops without any issues. Swapping between local SIMs in Europe was no problem, and I appreciated this a lot. The call quality was nice. The Jenny TV did a halfway decent job of taking photos (for a $30 phone, I didn't expect much). What I did like the most was the fact that I could throw in up to a 32gb microSDHC card and use this as a mp3 player. I loved that it had a radio and worked well to try to listen to local music. The TV will only pick up analog signals, so it's virtually useless inside the US and will become more useless over time. The battery is rated at 10 days and after a week with some phone calls, the phone was still going strong.The phone works, with features that would have been amazing nearly 10 years ago. However, it's $30 and it works. If I lose it or it breaks, I won't feel bad about it. It's a solid travel phone or for someone who just needs a phone, not a smartphone.

ProductInfo.Features:
Unlocked Dual SIM Quad-Band GSM cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 MHz frequencies for both SIM Slots.
2.8-Inch TFT Display, 240 x 320 pixels; Dual SIM Card Support; Bluetooth; 1.3MP Camera with Flash plus Video recorder; MP3 Ringtones and Flashlight.
MP3/MP4 Player; FM Radio, built-in FM antenna; Games; MicroSD Card Slot expendable up to 32GB
Social Network Applications: Facebook, Twitter, Skype, BLU Chat
Supports Analog TV
ProductInfo.Name: BLU T176T Jenny TV 2.8 Unlocked Quad-Band Dual SIM Phone (Black/Yellow)
